 
{{Client function}}
This function is used to return the current pause state of the specified [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]].

{{New feature/item|3.0132|1.3.2||
If the element is a [[/player.md|player]], this function will use the players voice.
}}
==Syntax== 
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">bool isSoundPaused ( element theSound )</syntaxhighlight> 
{{OOP||[[/sound.md|sound]]:isPaused|paused|setSoundPaused}}
===Required Arguments=== 
*'''theSound:''' the [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]] which pause state you want to return.

===Returns===
Returns ''true'' if the [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]] is paused, ''false'' if unpaused or invalid arguments were passed.

==Example== 
This example will check and see if the sound is paused or not, and tell the player.
<section name="Client" class="client" show="true">
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
theSound = playSound("music/song.mp3")
function checkSongPause()
    local pause = isSoundPaused(theSound)
    if(pause == true) then
        outputChatBox("The sound is paused!")
    else
        outputChatBox("The sound is not paused!")
    end
end
addCommandHandler("checkpause", checkSongPause)
</syntaxhighlight>
</section>
